meanings.definition: (adjective) attracting the most attention or excitement
meanings.sent1: The new movie is the buzziest in town.
meanings.sent2: The concert was the buzziest event of the year.
meanings.sent3: The buzziest topic at school was the upcoming talent show.
meanings.sent4: Her bright red dress was the buzziest thing in the room.
meanings.sent5: The internet sensation became the buzziest star overnight.

meanings.definition: (adverb) in a manner that is attracting the most attention or excitement
meanings.sent1: She walked into the party buzzily, turning heads.
meanings.sent2: The news spread buzzily throughout the small town.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed his tricks buzzily, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The fireworks lit up the sky buzzily, captivating everyone.
meanings.sent5: The fashion show ended buzzily, leaving the crowd wanting more.

meanings.definition: (noun) the state of being the most attention-grabbing or exciting
meanings.sent1: The buzziness of the event was undeniable.
meanings.sent2: The buzziness of the city during the festival was infectious.
meanings.sent3: The buzziness of the classroom before the surprise test was palpable.
meanings.sent4: The buzziness of the market on weekends attracted many visitors.
meanings.sent5: The buzziness of the theme park made it a popular destination.
